title: Job Asks to Speak to God Directly
summary: Job accuses his friends of being dishonest defenders of God. He insists on speaking to God himself and pleads for understanding. He asks why God is treating him as an enemy if he has done nothing wrong.

faq.question: What does Job want more than anything?
faq.answer: To present his case directly to God.

faq.question: What does Job accuse his friends of?
faq.answer: Speaking falsely and doing more harm than good.
